message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.CY 

The paper deals with the problem of detecting and reducing the spread of fake news and misinformation on online social networking sites. This involves developing algorithms to efficiently select which stories to send for fact checking and when to do so. The paper also introduces a flexible representation of the procedure using the framework of marked temporal point processes. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.SOC (Social and Societal Computing). Other likely sub-categories include cs.IR (Information Retrieval), cs.CL (Computation and Language), and cs.CY (Computers and Society).
